images.title: Kenneth Yarham / Nant Ffrancon from the head of Cwm Bual
images.caption: Nant Ffrancon from the head of Cwm Bual Cwm Bual leads down from the slopes of Foel-goch and provides a steady if tedious descent to the side road which leads from Idwal Cottage down the west side of Nant Ffrancon. It is actually a lot further than it looks here.

images.title: Ian Greig / The road winds ahead
images.caption: The road winds ahead

images.title: Llyn Ogwen by Mat Fascione, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Llyn Ogwen

description: A walk through the stunning Nant Ffrancon Valley from Bethesda to Llyn Ogwen. The steep-sided glacial valley runs through Snowdonia with wonderful views of the surrounding mountains and the River Ogwen. The route follows a section of Lon Las Ogwen along a quiet country lane suitable for walkers and cyclists. You finish at the beautiful Llyn Ogwen where there are waterfalls and a lovely lakeside path to enjoy. The route also follows a section of the Snowdonia Slate Trail, a long distance circular walk which explores the historical mining areas of the national park. The waymarked trail is a good way to extend the walk if you have time.
display_address: Pant, Bethesda, Gwynedd, Cymru / Wales, LL57 3AU, United Kingdom
